intro: Hieracium pseudopallidiflorum, commonly known as the pale-flowered hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
